briefTitle: Efficacy and Safety Study of Symbicort® Turbuhaler® Versus Oxis® Turbuhaler® in Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease (COPD) Patients
officialTitle: A Phase III, 12-week, Double-blind, Randomised, Parallel-group, Active-controlled, Multinational, Efficacy and Safety Study of Symbicort® Turbuhaler® 160/4.5 μg 2 Inhalations Twice Daily (Bid) Compared to Oxis® Turbuhaler® 4.5 μg 2 Inhalations Twice Daily (Bid) in Patients With Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease
summary: The primary purpose of the study is to investigate if Symbicort is more effective than Oxis in increasing forced expiratory volume in one second (FEV1), measured at the clinics, in patients with COPD.

primaryOutcome.measure: Pre-dose Forced Expiratory Volume in One Second (FEV1)
primaryOutcome.timeFrame: Before randomization, 0, 4, 8 and 12 weeks after randomization
